Be careful what you say about your competition

June 23, 2013

People donâ€™t like it when someone is attacked, especially when the attack seems unjustified or thereâ€™s an underdog being attacked. This is a reasonably common human trait that still operates in the world of business.

So, if you are up against a competitor with a prospective customer you should tread carefully. Iâ€™d recommend that your proposal talks about only about the way youâ€™ll solve their problem. Remember that part of the problem they have is in choosing a solution amongst different vendors. Build trust in your brand and solution.

Donâ€™t go cross the line into slamming the competition. This erodes trust very quickly. You donâ€™t know the relationships the prospect has or where that information will end up. You had better hope all the facts you used about the competition are totally squared away.

Be a company others want to do business with. And stop helping the competition.
